cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River and 200 miles SE of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW tonight, then NW Friday, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City or the south-central Louisiana coast

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Cameron
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast of Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with higher gusts possible Friday night through Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port itself; possible river level rise downstream due to surge in lower Mississippi.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause significant river and flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and prolonged river flooding that can disrupt terminal and roadway access.
